items.name: Cupids's Letter
descriptions:
My dearest Psyche,

I cannot bear to see you, but know that I still love you. You have angered my mother, Venus, by your mortal beauty that rivals her own. She will not allow our reunion until you prove yourself worthy.

Seek her at her Courtyard. She will set tasks for you - four impossible trials. Only by completing all four can we be together again.

Be brave, my love. Look for help in unexpected places.

Forever yours,
Cupid

P.S. Gather what you can from the cottage. You will need supplies for a long journey.

items.name: Garden Shears
descriptions: Sturdy iron shears with well-worn wooden handles. The blades are designed for cutting through thick vines and branches.

items.name: Honey Cakes
descriptions: Two small cakes dripping with golden honey. They would surely please any creature with a appetite. Use them to soothe guard beasts.

items.name: Crystal Vessel
descriptions: An empty crystal vessel, perfectly clear and beautifully crafted. It could hold water or any other liquid.
The crystal vessel now contains water from the River Styx. This is water from the boundary between life and death itself.

items.name: Bronze Coins
descriptions: Ancient bronze coins, worn smooth with age. Each bears the face of a forgotten ruler. These coins are used to pay passage across the River Styx - you'll need them to enter and exit the underworld.

items.name: Music Box
descriptions:
A silver music box engraved with images of sleeping animals. When wound, it plays a haunting lullaby that seems to reach into the very soul.

An inscription on the base reads:
'This melody soothes the savage heart,
Calms the beast that's set apart,
In meadows where fierce guardians dwell,
Play this tune and break their spell.'

You sense this could calm aggressive creatures if played in the right place.

items.name: Overgrown Vines
descriptions: Thick, thorny vines choke this once-beautiful garden. They wind around ancient statues and cover the ground in an impenetrable tangle. Among the thorns, you can glimpse a single perfect rose, but the vines are far too thick to pull by hand. You would need sharp garden shears to cut through them.

The vines lie cut and scattered across the garden floor. Where they once blocked your path, you can now clearly see a beautiful Sacred Rose growing in the center of the garden, free at last and ready to be collected.

items.name: Sacred Rose
descriptions: A rose that radiates a faint light and carries the scent of Venus's favor. It's blocked by vines.
A single perfect rose with petals that shimmer like mother-of-pearl. The rose will never wilt or fade.

items.name: Golden Pelt
descriptions: A magnificent pelt of golden fur that seems to capture and hold sunlight. It's surprisingly light yet radiates warmth. The fur is so fine it feels like silk between your fingers. This treasure was guarded by the wolves for good reason - it must be a sacred relic of great value.

items.name: Sealed Box
descriptions:
A small ornate box sealed with wax bearing Persephone's mark. It is said to contain a fragment of divine beauty itself. The box is warm to the touch and seems to pulse with an inner light.

Persephone's warning echoes in your mind: 'This beauty is not meant for mortal eyes. Deliver it sealed to Venus, or face eternal sleep.' The temptation to open it is strong, but the consequences would be dire.

You have opened the box. A glittering mist escapes and surrounds you. Your eyelids grow impossibly heavy. The world blurs and darkens. You sink to the ground, overwhelmed by an irresistible sleep from which there is no waking. The beauty of the gods was never meant for mortal eyes.

items.name: Rose Altar
descriptions: A marble pedestal carved with images of blooming roses. At its center is a shallow bowl, currently empty. An inscription reads: 'The First Trial - Restore the Sacred Garden and bring forth the Rose of Venus.' This altar awaits proof of your first task.

The Sacred Rose rests in the bowl, radiating soft light. The marble pedestal glows warmly. The inscription now reads: 'The First Trial is complete. Venus acknowledges your dedication to beauty and order.'

items.name: Pelt Altar
descriptions: A marble pedestal carved with images of wild beasts. At its center is a shallow bowl, currently empty. An inscription reads: 'The Second Trial - Calm the savage guardians and claim the Golden Pelt they protect.' This altar awaits proof of your second task.

The Golden Pelt lies draped across the bowl, gleaming in the light. The marble pedestal glows warmly. The inscription now reads: 'The Second Trial is complete. Venus acknowledges your courage and cunning.'

items.name: Vessel Altar
descriptions: A marble pedestal carved with images of flowing water and mountain eagles. At its center is a shallow bowl, currently empty. An inscription reads: 'The Third Trial - Bring water from the River Styx that flows beyond mortal reach.' This altar awaits proof of your third task.

The crystal vessel sits in the bowl, its ethereal contents glowing softly. The marble pedestal glows warmly. The inscription now reads: 'The Third Trial is complete. Venus acknowledges your resourcefulness and faith.'

items.name: Box Altar
descriptions: A marble pedestal carved with images of the underworld - skulls, pomegranates, and the three-headed dog Cerberus. At its center is a shallow bowl, currently empty. An inscription reads: 'The Fourth Trial - Journey to the depths of Hades and return with Persephone's sealed gift. DO NOT OPEN IT.' This altar awaits proof of your fourth and final task.

The sealed box rests in the bowl, still warm and pulsing with inner light. The marble pedestal glows warmly. The inscription now reads: 'The Fourth Trial is complete. Venus acknowledges your perseverance and self-control. All trials are finished. You have proven yourself worthy. Cupid's Palace now welcomes you.'

items.name: Signpost
descriptions:
→ Venus's Courtyard - 'Where the goddess judges mortals'
→ The Riverside - 'Follow the water's song'
→ The Mountain Path - 'Climb toward the heavens'
→ The Cave Entrance - 'Descent into darkness'
→ Cupid's Palace - 'The path of love'

items.name: Whispering Reeds
descriptions:
Tall reeds grow along the riverbank, swaying gently in the breeze. As you listen closely, they seem to whisper ancient wisdom:

'Beware the meadow where fierce wolves guard their treasure... Do not approach with force or theft in your heart... Seek instead the silver music box that rests nearby... Its melody can soothe even the most savage beast... Play it where the wolves dwell, and they will sleep... Only then can you claim what they protect...'

The reeds fall silent, their message delivered.

items.name: Eagle's Nest
descriptions:
A massive nest made of branches sits at the cliff's edge. You can see the gleam of a great eagle's eye watching you from above.

The River Styx flows far below, completely unreachable by mortal hands. The cliff is too sheer, the distance too great.

But eagles... eagles can go where mortals cannot.

If you were to leave your vessel here - to drop it at the cliff's edge - perhaps the noble eagle would take pity on you and fill it from the sacred waters below. The great birds have always been friends to those who show humility and trust.

items.name: Ancient Tower
descriptions:
An ancient stone structure stands at the cave entrance, covered in carved warnings and instructions. The text is worn but still legible:

'HEED THIS WISDOM, MORTAL:

To enter the underworld alive and return, you must prepare:

- Bring COINS for Charon the ferryman (one to enter, one to return)
- Bring CAKES for Cerberus the three-headed guardian (one to enter, one to return)
- Take NOTHING that belongs to the dead
- Speak to NO shades who beg for your help
- Above all: If Persephone grants you a sealed gift, DO NOT OPEN IT

Many have entered. Few have returned. Those who opened Persephone's gift sleep forever in the halls of Hades.'

You shiver as you read the final warning.

items.name: Charon's Ferry
descriptions: A weathered boat rocks gently at the shore of the River Styx. The silent ferryman, Charon, stands motionless, his hand outstretched. His hollow eyes expect payment - a bronze coin for passage. Without payment, you cannot cross into the realm of the dead.

Charon nods slowly as you pay the coin. He gestures for you to board the ferry. The boat glides silently across the dark waters of the Styx, carrying you deeper into the underworld. You will need another coin for the return journey.

items.name: Cerberus
descriptions: The three-headed dog Cerberus blocks the gates, each head snarling and snapping. His massive form fills the passage completely. Saliva drips from his fangs. He will not let you pass... unless you offer him something he desires. The honey cakes in your possession might satisfy his hunger.

Cerberus devours the honey cake eagerly, all three heads fighting over the sweet treat. As he eats, his aggression fades. He settles down with a satisfied rumble, allowing you to pass into Persephone's domain. You'll need another cake for your return journey.

items.name: Persephone's Throne
descriptions:
Persephone sits upon her throne of black marble, a crown of pomegranate flowers upon her head. Despite the darkness of this realm, she radiates a strange beauty.

She regards you with knowing eyes: 'So, Venus sends another mortal to fetch what she desires. Very well. I will give you this gift - a box containing a fragment of divine beauty.'

She hands you an ornate sealed box.

'But heed my warning, mortal: This beauty is not for your eyes. The curiosity that led you to look upon Cupid's face must not be repeated here. Deliver this box to Venus SEALED, or you will sleep forever in my halls. Do you understand?'

You take the box carefully. The final trial is in your hands.

locations.name: Psyche's Cottage
descriptions: A humble cottage where you have been living in exile since angering Venus. Feels empty and lonely without Cupid's presence.

locations.name: The Crossroads
descriptions:
You stand at a junction where multiple paths diverge. This is the heart of your journey - all roads lead from here. A weathered signpost points in different directions, and ancient bronze coins lie scattered on the ground (some previous traveler's misfortune, now your fortune).

The air here feels charged with possibility. North leads to Venus's domain. East follows a river. South climbs into mountains. West descends into darkness.

locations.name: Venus's Courtyard
descriptions:
A grand courtyard of white marble, beautiful and intimidating in equal measure. Statues of Venus in various poses line the walls, each carved with perfect beauty. The air smells of roses and incense.

Four marble pedestals stand in a semicircle - altars where you must prove you have completed the trials. Each altar is carved with different symbols and bears an inscription describing what it requires.

locations.name: The Sacred Garden
descriptions:
Venus's once-beautiful sacred garden has been choked by thick, thorny vines. They cover everything - the ground, the statues, the ancient stone benches. This is clearly the result of neglect... or perhaps a test.

Through gaps in the vines, you can see a single perfect rose still growing in the center of the garden, somehow untouched by the decay around it. The vines are far too thick to clear by hand.

locations.name: The Riverside
descriptions:
A peaceful riverbank where clear water flows over smooth stones. Tall reeds grow along the water's edge, swaying in the breeze. They seem to whisper secrets to those who listen carefully.

A delicate silver music box rests on a flat rock near the water, as if left here by someone who knew you would need it. The path east continues to a meadow.

locations.name: The Meadow
descriptions:
A wide meadow of tall grass and wildflowers. The scene would be beautiful if not for the pack of fierce wolves that patrol this area. They growl menacingly, their eyes tracking your every movement. In the center of the meadow, you can see something golden glinting in the sunlight - their treasure.

The wolves block your path. They will attack if you try to take what they guard. You need a way to calm them first.

The meadow is peaceful now. The wolves lie sleeping in the grass, lulled by the music box's enchanting melody. Their breathing is slow and steady. You can safely approach the golden pelt they were guarding - it lies in the center of the meadow, free for the taking.

locations.name: The Mountain Path
descriptions:
A narrow path winds up the mountainside, offering stunning views of the landscape below. The air grows thinner here. Rocky outcroppings provide shelter from the wind.

The path continues upward to a cliff edge to the south, or descends back to the meadow to the north. You can also see a dark cave entrance to the west.

locations.name: The Cliff Edge
descriptions:
You stand at the edge of a sheer cliff. Far, far below, you can see the glittering waters of a river - the River Styx, boundary between the living and the dead. The drop is impossibly steep. No mortal could climb down and return.

A massive eagle's nest sits on a rocky outcropping nearby. The great bird watches you with intelligent eyes. Perhaps it could reach what you cannot...

locations.name: The Cave Entrance
descriptions:
The mouth of a dark cave yawns before you. Cold air flows out from the depths, carrying the scent of earth and ancient stone. This is a gateway to the underworld itself - few mortals who enter ever return.

An ancient stone tower stands beside the entrance, covered in carved warnings and advice. Three honey cakes sit on a small stone shelf - left here by some previous traveler, or perhaps placed by helpful spirits.

locations.name: The River Styx
descriptions:
The River Styx flows black and silent through the underworld. The water seems to absorb all light and sound. On the near shore, Charon's ferry waits - a weathered boat that has carried countless souls to their final rest.

The ferryman himself stands motionless, neither living nor dead, his hand outstretched for payment. Beyond the river, you can see the Gates of Hades.

locations.name: The Gates of Hades
descriptions:
Massive black iron gates block the passage into the deepest parts of the underworld. Before them stands Cerberus, the three-headed guardian dog of Hades. Each of his heads snarls at you, teeth bared. His eyes glow red in the dim light.

Beyond him lies Persephone's Hall. You must get past this fearsome guardian to complete your final task.

locations.name: Persephone's Hall
descriptions:
The throne room of Persephone, Queen of the Underworld. Despite being in the realm of the dead, strange flowers bloom here - ghostly white asphodels and blood-red pomegranates. The air is cool but not unpleasant.

Persephone's throne dominates the chamber, carved from a single piece of black marble. The queen herself awaits, ready to give you what you seek... if you have made it this far.

locations.name: Cupid's Palace
descriptions: The grand doors to Cupid's Palace stand before you, carved with images of hearts and wings. They are sealed tight, bound by divine magic. A plaque reads: 'Love cannot be claimed until worthiness is proven. Complete all trials set by Venus, and these doors shall open.' The magic will not yield until all four altars in Venus's Courtyard acknowledge your success.

You step through the doors into a palace of breathtaking beauty. Golden light fills every corner. Flowers bloom in impossible colors. The air itself seems to shimmer with joy and love.

And there, waiting for you with tears of happiness in his eyes, is Cupid.

He rushes forward and embraces you. 'You did it, my love. You completed every impossible task. Venus cannot deny us now. We are finally free to be together.'

Your trials are over. Your love has been proven. This is your happy ending.

endings.reason: You step into Cupid's Palace and are reunited with your true love. After completing all four impossible trials, Venus can no longer keep you apart. Your perseverance, courage, and wisdom have proven you worthy. Together at last, you and Cupid embrace as the palace fills with golden light. Love has triumphed over all obstacles.

Time has run out. You wandered too long without completing the trials. Venus's patience has expired, and the tasks have failed. The magic that bound your quest dissipates. You will never see Cupid again. Your love story ends in eternal separation.

The wolves awaken from their enchanted sleep and see you with their sacred treasure! In a fury, they attack. You stood no chance against the pack. The golden pelt falls from your lifeless hands. You should have left the meadow while the wolves still slumbered.

You opened Persephone's box. The divine beauty within was never meant for mortal eyes. A glittering mist envelops you, and an irresistible sleep descends. Your body crumples to the ground. You will sleep forever in the halls of Hades, another victim of curiosity and hubris. Persephone warned you, but you could not resist.
